title: Watch These S&P 500 Chart Levels as More Tariffs Loom
snippets: The S&P 500 has experienced a downturn, losing ground in five of the last six weeks due to concerns over tariffs and the potential for an economic recession. This decline was marked by a breakdown below a flag pattern, indicating a possible continuation of the downward trend. Investors are advised to watch for key support levels at 5,445 and 5,260, and resistance levels at 5,875 and 6,090. The ongoing volatility is partly attributed to uncertainties around tariff policies and their impact on inf
summary: The S&P 500 index has fallen 2% on Friday, marking a loss in five of the last six weeks, closing at 5,581. This downturn, now 9% below its record high from last month, is largely due to concerns over tariffs and fears of a recession. Technical analysis indicates a potential continuation of this decline, with investors watching for specific support and resistance levels. The ongoing market volatility is attributed to uncertainties surrounding tariff policies.
